intro: Ecdysanthera glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular spurred orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and glandular structures on its leaves and stems. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellow, with a unique morphology that aids in pollination by specific insects. The botanical features of Ecdysanthera glandulifera make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
